answers.answer: I never got migraines before I was pregnant they started when I was about 33 weeks pregnant. Try to lay down and sit in a cool dark quiet room. And drink lots of water

Take vitamin B 100 and magnesium.  Start with only a half pill of the magnesium, it might be all you will need and it could give you some abdominal cramps (like those associated with the runs) if you get too much.  But the B 100 works well with the magnesium to ease headaches that are related to either migraine or hormones.
An ice pack to the base of your head and neck works very well. My ob suggested that to me when I was having problems with headaches. Good luck

My doctor said head aches is your body's way of saying it needs more water. Even when I told her that I drink it all day. She said obviously the baby doesn't think so and wants more. Haha haven't gotten one since.
You might just want To take Tylenol and drink water if it doesn't go away id call your hospital cause my doctor said a headache that doesn't go away with water and Tylenol is a sign of preeclampsia
Try ice cold towels over your forehead and eyes (that possibly reach your temples) and one on the back of your neck. Like laying on your side to hold them in place.

question: Im 34 weeks pregnant as of today.  Everytime I go to the Dr. my blood pressure and everyrhing else is spot on and they always seem very pleased with my progress. Last night a dull ache on each side of my head started and has progeressed to unbearable throbbing.  I haven't been able to shake it. I know there are some medicines its okay to take when pregnant but I would rather not. Anyone have any other alternatives? I really hate taking pain relievers even though I know those with Acetaminophen are safe. I am really hoping for other cures.
title: Headache that just wont quit
